metadata.title: AI Risk Taxonomy
metadata.description: A comprehensive taxonomy of AI risks organized by OECD principles

risks.OECD Principle: Inclusive growth, sustainable development and wellbeing
risks.Vector: Creates high levels of e waste

risks.OECD Principle: Inclusive growth, sustainable development and wellbeing
risks.Vector: Deployment leads to AI causing unforeseen environmental consequences

risks.OECD Principle: Inclusive growth, sustainable development and wellbeing
risks.Vector: Incentivises environmentally damaging behaviours

risks.OECD Principle: Inclusive growth, sustainable development and wellbeing
risks.Vector: Depletion of global physical resources

risks.OECD Principle: Inclusive growth, sustainable development and wellbeing
risks.Vector: Opaque resource consumption requirements & environmental impacts

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Removing human choice through automation

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Coercive or manipulative system design

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Overriding human judgment

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Inability to contest decisions

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Restriction of freedom of expression

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Interference with freedom of association

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Violation of human dignity

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Infringement of religious freedoms

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Denial of cultural rights

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Interference with collective governance (e.g. vote manipulation)

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: People do not know where their data is going / who profits from their data, or stop it

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: People cannot or do not know how to access or modify their own data

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: People cannot delete their data (potentially damaging or sensitive)

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: There are no channels to contact to establish data control (e.g. delete or amend)

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Data used beyond original stated purpose

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Unauthorized data monetisation

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Data is shared with third parties without consent

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Manipulation through collected personal information

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Absent, incomplete, or misleading informed consent process

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Unauthorised surveillance

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Specific groups benefit or are harmed disproportionately

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Odds of advantageous outcome are unequal

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: AI does not work for or works improperly for a class or group

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: AI-generated content misrepresents or erases certain groups' experiences or perspectives

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Certain groups receive disproportionate false positives or false negatives in AI decisions

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: AI is unavailable to or less accessible by a class or a group

risks.OECD Principle: Human rights and democratic values, including fairness and privacy
risks.Vector: Systems reinforce or amplify existing stereotypes in their outputs
System documentation is insufficient for oversight
Model cards or datasheets are incomplete or missing
Audit trails are inadequate or unavailable
Incident reports are not properly logged or maintained

risks.Risk type: Lack of transparency around data practices
risks.Vector: Data provenance is opaque

risks.Risk type: Lack of transparency around data practices
risks.Vector: Data collection methods (and ethics) are opaque

risks.Risk type: Lack of transparency around data practices
risks.Vector: Data sharing arrangements are not disclosed

risks.Risk type: Lack of transparency around data practices
risks.Vector: Data retention policies are unclear

risks.Risk type: Lack of transparency around data practices
risks.Vector: Changes in data practices occur without notification

risks.Risk type: Lack of system transparency (how the AI works)
risks.Vector: People do not understand how decisions are made

risks.Risk type: Lack of system transparency (how the AI works)
risks.Vector: Scope and capabilities of AI systems are not clear to users

risks.Risk type: Lack of system transparency (how the AI works)
risks.Vector: Limitations of AI systems are not disclosed to users

risks.Risk type: Lack of system transparency (how the AI works)
risks.Vector: Role of AI in decisions/processes is not disclosed

risks.Risk type: Lack of system transparency (how the AI works)
risks.Vector: System updates occur without appropriate notification

risks.Risk type: Lack of system transparency (how the AI works)
risks.Vector: Changes in AI capabilities are not communicated

risks.Risk type: Lack of system transparency (how the AI works)
risks.Vector: Shifts in operational parameters are not disclosed

risks.Risk type: Lack of system transparency (how the AI works)
risks.Vector: Unclear confidence levels in outputs (e.g. indicating more certainty than really exists)
Inability to interpret model decisions or behaviour patterns, causing poor safety or ethical outcomes
Unexplainable feature interactions in decisions (e.g. resulting in unexplained biases)
Unclear decision criteria makes system difficult to debug or improve safety
Unclear causal relationships
Unexplained edge cases causes risks in unexpected situations and makes it hard to fix them
Unexplainable sequencing of inferences negatively affects outcomes and cannot be fixed
Decision or behavioural drift over time

risks.Risk type: Poor or absent decision making logging process
risks.Vector: Decision histories are not available, accurate enough, or processed properly for useful evaluation and improvement
Documentation is unavailable or not sufficient to support checks or monitoring
A person or community experiencing an adverse impact cannot find anyone to report it to
A person or community likewise cannot seek recompense for harms
Some groups face higher barriers than others to contesting or appealing AI decisions
External manipulation of deployed system causing harmful decisions
Compromise of development pipeline leading to harmful system behaviours
Unauthorised access to system capabilities enabling infrastructure attacks
Targeted data extraction by state actors or threat groups
Unintended exposure of sensitive or prohibited information with no threat actor
Theft of sensitive data for commercial exploitation
Self-modification of core constraints by the system
Corruption of internal representations leading to processing errors
Aggressive resource optimisation causing system instability
Accumulating errors in system's world model leading to harmful actions
Catastrophic performance failures under edge cases or context shifts
Integration failures with external systems causing unsafe behaviour
System developing methods to bypass control mechanisms
System optimisation processes evolving to counteract restrictions
Development of covert manipulation of human operators
System optimises for hidden objectives while maintaining apparent compliance
Runaway optimisation feedback loops causing accelerating negative impacts
System complexity exceeding effective human oversight capabilities
Concealment of system activities from monitoring mechanisms
Rapid development of capabilities beyond intended scope
Emergence of unintended self-improvement capabilities
Novel forms of system-environment interaction causing harm
Internal subsystem competition leading to harmful outcomes
Emergence of harmful behaviours from system networks exceeding individual capabilities
Collective system behaviours circumventing individual safety measures
Large-scale harm from uncoordinated actions across multiple systems
